info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 11 at 2:44PM PDT until April 13 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 14 to 20 inches with up to 30 inches over higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades including including Highways 58, 62, 230, and 138. This also includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Crescent Lake, the resort at Willamette Pass, and Union Creek. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Tree damage is possible from snow loading. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may approach an inch an hour at times. Snowfall will not be constant and let up mid day Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is discouraged because of the conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
